headline: MSCI Inc (MSCI) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Strong Growth in Revenue and Share Repurchases
summary: MSCI Inc (MSCI) reports robust financial performance with significant growth in revenue, earnings, and strategic share repurchases, while leveraging AI for future innovations.

headline: Why MSCI (MSCI) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of investment analytics provider MSCI (NYSE:MSCI) jumped 3.1% in the morning session after the company reported strong third-quarter financial results that topped expectations, which was followed by a new share repurchase program and positive analyst actions.

headline: Is MSCI’s Recent 5.6% Rally Enough to Justify Its Lofty Share Price?
summary: Wondering whether MSCI is actually worth its lofty price tag? You are not alone, especially if you are evaluating it as a potential long-term investment. The stock has seen a 5.6% jump over the past week, though it is still down 5.0% for the year to date. This signals both resilience and shifting investor sentiment. Recent headlines have centered on MSCI's expanding role in powering ESG and index solutions for institutional investors, as more funds adopt nuanced strategies that rely on their...

headline: MSCI Launches Public Offering of Senior Unsecured Notes
summary: NEW YORK, October 30, 2025--MSCI Inc. (NYSE: MSCI), a leading provider of critical decision support tools and services for the global investment community, announced today that it has commenced an offering of senior unsecured notes (the "notes") in a registered public offering (the "Offering"). The proposed Offering is subject to market and other conditions. headline: MSCI (MSCI) Margin Miss Challenges Bullish Narratives Despite Strong Earnings Track Record
summary: MSCI (MSCI) is forecast to grow earnings by 10.36% and revenue by 8% annually, building on a five-year track record where earnings expanded at an average of 15.2% per year. However, growth has slowed in the most recent period, with earnings rising just 1.3% and the net profit margin dipping to 40% from last year's 43.1%. Investors will be weighing these tempered growth rates and margin pressure against the company’s strong history, mindful that MSCI currently trades at a premium to both peers...
